chargeHist.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tristan J. Wager was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tristan J. Wager is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tristan J. Wager was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

Payment of $100 fine + costs + fees + DNA Surcharge + Domestic Abuse surcharge= $679.00 due at $100 per month beginning 12-01-2022 or civil judgment and referral to state debt collections.

Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.

Waives formal readings.

Court calls case.
Case is a Branch 2 case, but being heard for bond purposes in Branch 1 today.
Atty Hansen is present for bond purposes only.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties.
Court inquires on Atty.
Deft to contact the Public Defenders office today for evaluation.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Hansen heard on bond.

Court schedules with parties.
